newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Poll shows Ecuadorans back Alarcon.
newsitem.headline: Poll shows Ecuadorans back Alarcon.

text.p: Most Ecuadoreans will vote to ratify President Fabian Alarcon in a referendum May 25, according to a private poll Wednesday.

Some 78 percent of poll respondents said they would back Alarcon to stay on as interim president until elections in August 1998, while 22 percent said they would vote against him, said Blasco Penaherrera, director of Market, a private consultancy.
Alarcon was appointed interim president in February after Congress deposed President Abdala Bucaram on grounds of "mental insufficiency".
The government hopes a resounding victory for Alarcon in the May referendum will silence Bucaram's accusations that he was overthrown in a coup d'etat.
The poll of 1,600 people was carried out Monday and Tuesday in Ecuador's four biggest cities. Penaherrera did not specify its calculated margin of error.
